alert.note: Alert for Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 6:31AM EDT until August 22 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Atlantic, Burlington, Camden, and Ocean. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Barnegat, Hammonton, Shamong, Tuckerton, Presidential Lakes Estates, Penn State Forest, Chatsworth, Old Halfway, Warren Grove, Bass River State Forest, Wharton State Forest, and Brookville. - This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 52 and 76. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
